p: There are four CHIKV genotypes (or lineages), which have been named based on their geographical distribution: (i) the West African; (ii) the East/Central/South African (ECSA); (iii) the Asian; and (iv) the Indian Ocean Lineage (IOL), which emerged from the ECSA lineage between 2005 and 2006 [ 10â€“ 12]. Studies have shown that several IOL strains presented a series of mutations including the E1-A226V adaptive mutation that confers an increased replication rate in Aedes albopictus, thus enhancing viral transmission potential [ 11, 13, 14].
